column2: In this paper, we have identified features of elec-

column2: tronic discussions that influence clustering perfor-

column3: page=6 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: moves adverse influences. The effect of our filtering
column3: page=6 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: mechanism was evaluated by means of two experi-
column3: page=6 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ments: coarse-level clustering and simple informa-
column3: page=6 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion retrieval. Our results show that filtering out the
column3: page=6 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: signature words of dominant speakers has a posi-
column3: page=6 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tive effect on clustering and retrieval performance.
column3: page=6 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column3: page=6 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: domain, our results indicate that filtering signature
column3: page=6 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=6 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tering electronic discussions.
